name: confucius

procedures: T1041::[Confucius] has exfiltrated stolen files to its C2 server.
T1053.005::[Confucius] has created scheduled tasks to maintain persistence on a compromised host.
T1059.001::[Confucius] has used PowerShell to execute malicious files and payloads.
T1059.005::[Confucius] has used VBScript to execute malicious code.
T1071.001::[Confucius] has used HTTP for C2 communications.
T1082::[Confucius] has used a file stealer that can examine system drives, including those other than the C drive.
T1083::[Confucius] has used a file stealer that checks the Document, Downloads, Desktop, and Picture folders for documents and images with specific extensions.
T1105::[Confucius] has downloaded additional files and payloads onto a compromised host following initial access.
T1119::[Confucius] has used a file stealer to steal documents and images with the following extensions: txt, pdf, png, jpg, doc, xls, xlm, odp, ods, odt, rtf, ppt, xlsx, xlsm, docx, pptx, and jpeg.
T1203::[Confucius] has exploited Microsoft Office vulnerabilities, including CVE-2015-1641, CVE-2017-11882, and CVE-2018-0802.
T1204.001::[Confucius] has lured victims into clicking on a malicious link sent through spearphishing.
T1204.002::[Confucius] has lured victims to execute malicious attachments included in crafted spearphishing emails related to current topics.
T1218.005::[Confucius] has used mshta.exe to execute malicious VBScript.
T1221::[Confucius] has used a weaponized Microsoft Word document with an embedded RTF exploit.
T1547.001::[Confucius] has dropped malicious files into the startup folder `%AppData%\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup` on a compromised host in order to maintain persistence.
T1566.001::[Confucius] has crafted and sent victims malicious attachments to gain initial access.
T1566.002::[Confucius] has sent malicious links to victims through email campaigns.
T1567.002::[Confucius] has exfiltrated victim data to cloud storage service accounts.
T1583.006::[Confucius] has obtained cloud storage service accounts to host stolen data.

description: [Confucius](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0142) is a cyber espionage group that has primarily targeted military personnel, high-profile personalities, business persons, and government organizations in South Asia since at least 2013. Security researchers have noted similarities between [Confucius](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0142) and [Patchwork](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0040), particularly in their respective custom malware code and targets.(Citation: TrendMicro Confucius APT Feb 2018)(Citation: TrendMicro Confucius APT Aug 2021)(Citation: Uptycs Confucius APT Jan 2021)
